"Good, good, great Yakṣa generals!

source_sentence: 汝等念報七佛如來恩德。
translation: All of you are mindful of the merits of the seven Tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 常應如是利益安樂一切有情。
translation: You should always thus benefit and comfort all sentient beings.'
Thus praising and permitting, may it be so at this time.

source_sentence: 引領調順一切善眾赴此供養。
translation: May I now lead and tame all the good people to this offering.
Accept and make offerings with kindness and compassion.
Complete our ritual and pathway sites.
May we, all sentient beings, also see and obtain the merits described in the sūtras.

source_sentence: 見前獲得如經所說功德善利。
translation: See before us the merits and good benefits described in the sūtras.
May it be tolerated and granted, and may it be granted.
Also, may the seven buddhas' original vows be granted as merits in the sutra.
and all the Dharma treasures of the sutras.
May they long abide in the world and spread them in ten directions.
May they greatly prosper and bring benefit to sentient beings.
May we also accept and uphold the teaching.

source_sentence: 及國界中所有人民及諸孳畜。
translation: ...and all the people and farm animals in our country's borders.

source_sentence: 而生種種疾病疫癘種種患難。
translation: May various illnesses, epidemics, and various afflictions arise.
Droughts, floods, frosts, and hailstorms damage crops.
All kinds of evil demons, creatures, and monsters will have bad appearances.
Unlucky things disturb sentient beings.
These kinds of bad spirits and ghosts are always present in the country, going and coming to harm them.
They are always present in the country, coming and going to cause harm.
They cause disasters and calamities such as these.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)等由先業招或現業感。
translation: We (certain person(s)) are brought about by prior actions or caused by present actions.
We'll continue our lineage from father to son in various places.
With (so-and-so) and others, we'll be reborn in our countries and borders.
We're endowed with the power and independence of our retinue.
Their people produce all kinds of great things.
They create obstacles for the spirits.

source_sentence: 以諸方便隨各作宜悉皆調伏。
translation: He uses various skillful means to tame them all as appropriate.
They abandon hostility and harmful thoughts.
With kindness, he'll remove all adversity.

source_sentence: 諸不吉祥一切惡事願皆隱沒。
translation: May all inauspicious and unwholesome things be hidden.
From now on, he'll cause spirits and devils to depart.
Don't give rise to evil thoughts, and don't act as an obstruction.

source_sentence: 隨各部類於諸聖前令自發願。
translation: According to each species, he causes himself to vow before the sages.
'Establish a vow to abide in the samaya.'
Always perform good deeds as thus manifested.

source_sentence: 願垂攝授願賜攝授　如是一一由諸供養發願祈禱已。
translation: May it be gathered in and granted, and may it be gathered in. After making these various offerings and vowing and praying, he then recites the dhāraṇī and causes it to be performed.

source_sentence: 復次誦陀羅尼令作沐浴。
translation: Then, he recites the dhāraṇī and makes it bathe.

source_sentence: 復於諸聖通申供養又祈禱云　依七佛如來本願功德經儀軌。
translation: He then made offerings to the sages and prayed, "According to the rituals of the Sutra on the Merit of the Former Vows of the Seven Buddhas and Tathāgatas, we'll build an incense altar and make offerings to the site of enlightenment.
He builds an incense altar and makes offerings to the site of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 奉請婆伽梵如來應正等覺。
translation: He invoked the tathāgata Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Yingzheng and the Fully Awakened One.

source_sentence: 七佛如來釋迦牟尼佛一切聖眾。
translation: The seven Tathāgatas, the Tathāgatas, and the Śākyamuni Buddha are all holy beings.
They invoke their holy names and venerate them with respect.
He also made a great vow, just as he had vowed.
He repents of his sins before the sages.
He follows the good roots of joy and invites them to turn the wheel of the Dharma.
He encourages the power of good roots that abide in the world.

source_sentence: 及仗威德微妙上願攝授之力。
translation: He also relies on the power of the subtle and marvelous superior vows of the mighty virtues to collect and bestow them.

source_sentence: 伏願大聖皇帝無始已來。
translation: May the great sage emperor wish that all sins and deeds from beginningless time onward would be extinguished.
May all his sins and karma cease completely.
He'll have no illness and his life will be prolonged.
May the crown of heaven be permanently secured, and his treasured domain know no bounds.

source_sentence: 世出世間種種盛事願得豐富。
translation: May the various worldly and supramundane events of the world be abundant.
May he complete the two kinds of accumulation of merit and wisdom.
Attaining the ultimate realization, I vow to become the Dharma king of the three realms.
He'll attain the adamantine jewel status of correct enlightenment.
All the officials, the common people, and all the people.
Without internal or external difficulty, they'll be comfortable and abundant.
Their ultimate vow is to realize unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 又願國內一切人民及諸眾生。
translation: Also, may all the people and sentient beings within the country.
All diseases and epidemics will cause various calamities.
Their crops won't ripen, and they'll be attacked by enemies and thieves.
May inauspicious circumstances be eliminated.

source_sentence: 風雨順時五穀豐登孳畜增益。
translation: When the wind and rain are favorable, may the five crops be abundant and the livestock be prolific.

source_sentence: 一切人民及諸眾生永受快樂。
translation: All people and sentient beings will experience lasting happiness.
In the future, they'll wish to be born in the paradise world.
Meet the Bhagavān and hear the wonderful Dharma.
They'll quickly attain the perfect fulfillment of the two kinds of accumulation.
They will quickly realize the unsurpassed buddhahood and enlightenment.
May the treasures of the Dharma forever abide in the world.
May it greatly prosper and bring benefit to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 復次求索忍納奉送者　婆伽梵如來應正等覺七佛如來。
translation: "Furthermore, I'd like to ask for permission to send Bhagavān Tathāgata, the seven buddha-tathāgatas who are worthy of perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我等導師釋迦牟尼佛菩薩聖眾。
translation: We are the instructors of the holy congregation of Śākyamuni Buddha and the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)等為諸有情請作利益故。
translation: We (certain ones) ask for the benefit of sentient beings.
But it's because of us, sentient beings of the bad world.

source_sentence: 心行鄙劣皆不清淨無知放逸。
translation: Our mental conduct is base and impure, and we're ignorant and careless.
Our bodily actions, speech, and thought are shared with the afflictions.

source_sentence: 供養資具不能具足垢染觸污。
translation: Their provisions aren't complete, and they're stained by defilement and contact.
They don't cultivate their manner and conduct in ways that accord with the Dharma.
These are the sins and offenses that go against the noble intentions.
May the noble ones not abandon compassion.
Have compassion on us and grant us forbearance.
May all of our good deeds not be turned into obstructions.
May they not be turned into obstructions.

source_sentence: 惟願如是願垂攝授願賜攝授　奉送者。
translation: May it be so, may it be collected and granted, and may it be granted. Those who present it to you.

source_sentence: 汝今利益有情已　　隨所希求賜成就　奉送世尊歸本土　　當請慈悲願降臨惟願世尊具大慈悲憐愍我等。
translation: 'Now that you've benefited sentient beings and granted the completion of whatever you seek, I'll send the Bhagavān back to my homeland, invoking compassion and vowing to descend upon it. May the Bhagavān have great compassion and kindness for us.
Having already done so, invite the noble ones to benefit us.
With great supernormal powers, we vow to return to our homeland.

source_sentence: 藥師琉璃光王七佛本願功德經念誦儀軌卷下
translation: Ritual Procedure for Recitation of the Sutra on the Merit of the Former Vows of the Seven Medicine-Master Lapis Light Kings, Volume 2
